intro: Viola chelmea subsp. chelmea, commonly known as the common violet, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, featuring heart-shaped, hairy leaves and clusters of violet or purple flowers. The plant prefers moist, well-drained soils and partial to full shade, making it a common garden plant. Its flowers bloom in spring, and it is known for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in temperate climates. The species is also valued for its historical use in herbal medicine.
